A name used to identify an anchorage. An anchorage is defined as an area in which vessels anchor or may anchor. (IHO Concept Register).
A name used to identify an anchorage. An anchorage is defined as an area in which vessels anchor or may anchor. (IHO Concept Register).
A name used to identify a terminal. A terminal covers that area on shore which provides buildings and constructions for the transfer of cargo or passengers from and to ships. (IHO Concept register).
A name used to identify a terminal. A terminal covers that area on shore which provides buildings and constructions for the transfer of cargo or passengers from and to ships. (IHO Concept register).

The name, number or description used to identify a Pilot boarding place. A Pilot boarding place is the location offshore where a pilot may board a vessel in preparation to piloting it through local waters. (IHO Concept register).

A name, number or description used to identify a Pilot boarding place. A Pilot boarding place is the location offshore where a pilot may board a vessel in preparation to piloting it through local waters. (IHO Concept register).
A name used to identify a berth. A berth is defined as a place, generally named or numbered, where a vessel may moor or anchor. (IHO Concept register).

A name, number or description used to identify a berth position. A berth position is a specific position within a berth where a vessel may be moored or anchored. (IHO Concept register).

Maximum ship present static draught in meters and centimeters.

Brief details of weather and sea conditions prevailing.

A code indicating the true direction, in tens of degrees, from which wind is blowing (of will blow).

A code indicating the state of the sea by significant wave height.
The name of the organization from which information on dangerous goods can be obtained.
The mobile number of the organization from which information on dangerous goods can be obtained.
The landline telephone number of the organization from which information on dangerous goods can be obtained.

Data Element: Dangerous goods contact address street and number
Definition: The street and number of the organization from which information on dangerous goods can be obtained.
The contact email address of the organization from which information on dangerous goods can be obtained.
A code specifying the type of contact for dangerous goods.

Data Element: Ship reporting system remarks type, coded
Definition: A code representing the type of remark to the ship’s report.
Any other information to the ship’s report including brief details of incident and of other ships involved either in incident, assistance or salvage.
Brief details of defects, damage, deficiencies or other limitations.

Data Element: Ship defects or limitations types, coded
Definition: A code representing the type of defects or limitations.
A “Yes/No” indicator of the ability of the ship to transfer cargo ballast/fuel.
The name of the waypoint.
The difference in tonnes between the displacement of a ship in water of a specific gravity of 1.025 at the actual draught and the lightweight of the ship.
Maximum length of a vessel's hull over the extreme points between fore and aft of the ship.
The maximum breadth over the extreme points between port side and starboard side of the ship.
The height from the waterline to the highest point of the ship.
The number of personnel with medical education (e.g. doctors, nurses).
The number of personnel with medical training.
The number of personnel without medical training but engaged in administrative, caring or other medical tasks onboard.
Date when the building contract is placed between ship builder and ship owner.
Date on which keel was laid or ship was at similar stage of construction.
Date of delivery of the ship from the ship builder to the ship owner.
A code representing the type of organization within a Member State that has the responsibility of the ship.
A “yes/no” indicator whether the ship is in class of the classification society.
Date of entry into class of the classification society.
A code representing the classification society currently having the ship in class.
The name of the classification society currently having the ship in class.

Definition: Identifier assigned to the ship by the classification society.
A code representing the status of class certificate (referring to the class rules) for the ship.
Class notation(s) assigned by the classification society.
The difference in tonnes between the displacement of a ship in water of a specific gravity of 1.025 at the draught and the lightweight of the ship.
A code providing the role of the ship company.
The identifier to be provided by the sender of the data when the company does not have an IMO identification number.

A code representing the status with respect to the resolution of the comment.

Reference to the code of the regulation/rule and the specific applicable chapters/paragraphs.

A code identifying the relevant Port State Control Memorandum of Understanding or regime.

The date the inspection comment  was closed.

Agreed actions as per rectification action plan.

Data Element: Total number of ballast tanks on board
Definition: Total number of ballast tanks on board certified to carry ballast water.
The number of tanks with ballast water as the ship arrives into the Arrival Port.

Data Element: Approved ballast water management plan on board indicator
Definition: A "yes/no" indicator of whether the ship is carrying an approved ballast water management plan on board.

Data Element: Implementation of ballast water management plan indicator
Definition: A "yes/no" indicator whether the ship management plan is implemented.

Data Element: Reason(s) why no ballast water management was conducted, coded
Definition: The explanation of why any ballast tanks or holds to be discharged are not managed in accordance with B-3.

Data Element: The starting date required to meet regulation D-2
Definition: The date from which the ship is required to comply with regulation D-2 of the Ballast Water Management Convention, 2004.

Data Element: Total number of ballast tanks and holds to be discharged
Definition: The total number of ballast tanks and holds to be discharged.

Data Element: Number of ballast tanks and holds to be discharged, D-1
Definition: The number of tanks and holds to be discharged that were managed in accordance with regulation D-1 (BW exchange standard).

Data Element: Number of ballast tanks and holds to be discharged, D-2
Definition: The number of ballast tanks and holds to be discharged that were managed in accordance with regulation D-2 (BW performance standard).

Data Element: Number of ballast tanks and holds to be discharged, not managed
Definition: The number of ballast tanks and holds to be discharged that have not been managed.

Data Element: Ballast tank or hold type, coded
Definition: Type of ballast tank containing ballast water.
A measure of the maximum tank/hold capacity in cubic meters.
Date of ballast water uptake into tanks/holds before ballast water management practices.

Data Element: Location of ballast water uptake, latitude
Definition: The latitude (geographical coordinate) of the location of  ballast water uptake in to tanks/holds before ballast water management practices.

The name and country of the port of the ballast water uptake.
Current volume in the ballast tanks/holds after the last uptake of ballast water in cubic metres (m3).

Data Element: Method(s) of ballast water management, coded

Any other ballast water management method used.
Date implementing ballast water management.

Data Element: Location where ballast water exchange or flushing started, latitude

Data Element: Location where ballast water exchange or flushing started, longitude

Definition: The latitude (geographical coordinate) of the location where ballast water exchange or flushing ended.

Data Element: Location where ballast water exchange or flushing ended, longitude
Definition: The longitude (geographical coordinate) of the location where ballast water exchange or flushing ended.
The volume of ballast water exchanged in cubic metres.

Data Element: Exchange percentage of ballast water exchanged
Definition: The percentage of ballast water exchanged, calculated by dividing the total volume of water moved by "Sequential" or "Flow-through" or used in "Saltwater flushing" by the capacity of ballast tank or hold, then multiply by 100.

Data Element: Minimum depth of water where ballast water exchange took place
Definition: The minimum depth of water where the ballast water exchange took place, in metres.
A measure of the salinity of water used for ballast water management practices in Practical Salinity Units (PSU).

The latitude (geographical coordinate) of the location of discharging ballast water.
The longitude (geographical coordinate) of the proposed location of discharging ballast water.

Data Element: Port of discharge of ballast water, coded

Data Element: Port of discharge of ballast water name
Definition: The name and country of the proposed port of discharge of ballast water

The name of the port reception facility provider.
The name of the treatment facility provider, if different from the port reception facility provider.

Data Element: Waste delivery date and time, from

Data Element: Waste delivery date and time, to

Data Element: Date and time to location in port - estimated

The latitude (geographical coordinate) of an entity.
The longitude (geographical coordinate) of an entity.
A code used to identify an anchorage. An anchorage is defined as an area in which vessels anchor or may anchor. (IHO Concept register).
A code used to identify an anchorage. An anchorage is defined as an area in which vessels anchor or may anchor. (IHO Concept register).
A code used to identify a terminal. A terminal covers that area on shore which provides buildings and constructions for the transfer of cargo or passengers from and to ships. (IHO Concept register).
A code used to identify a terminal. A terminal covers that area on shore which provides buildings and constructions for the transfer of cargo or passengers from and to ships. (IHO Concept register).
A code used to identify a berth. A berth is defined as a place, generally named or numbered, where a vessel may moor or anchor. (IHO Concept register).
A code used to identify a berth. A berth is defined as a place, generally named or numbered, where a vessel may moor or anchor. (IHO Concept register).
Other control action If ballast water management were not conducted.
Additional numbers or letters that may be used to identify the ship, as an alternative or in addition to the Ship call sign, the MMSI number or the IMO number.

Data Element: Ship date of construction, Ballast Water Management Convention
Definition: The date of construction as defined in regulation A-1.4 of the Ballast Water Management Convention.

Data Element: Total number of ballast holds on board
Definition: Total number of cargo holds on board that are designed to carry ballast water.
The number of holds with ballast water as ship arrives into the Arrival Port.

Data Element: Principal ballast water management method(s) of the ship, coded
Definition: A code representing the principal ballast water management method(s) employed on this ship as stated on the Ballast Water Management certificate.

Data Element: Principal ballast water management method of the ship description
Definition: A description of the principal management method(s) employed on this ship, when required.

Data Element: Number of ballast tanks and holds to be discharged, both D-1 and D-2
Definition: The number of ballast tanks and holds to be discharged that were managed in accordance with both regulations D-1 and D-2.

Data Element: Number of ballast tanks and holds to be discharged, other method
Definition: The number of ballast tanks and holds to be discharged that were managed using another method.

Data Element: Number of ballast tanks and holds to be discharged, other method – description
Definition: The description of the ballast water management method for tanks and holds to be discharged if other than according to D-1 and/or D-2.

Data Element: Number of ballast tanks and holds to be discharged, other method –reason
Definition: The reason that an other ballast water management method was used for the tanks and holds.

Data Element: Reason(s) why no ballast water management was conducted, description

Data Element: Ballast water management system manufacturer name
Definition: The name of the  manufacturer of the ballast water management system.

Data Element: Ballast water management system model name
Definition: The name of the model of the ballast water management system.

Data Element: Ballast water management system last bypass date
Definition: The date of the last bypass of the ballast water management system.

Data Element: Ballast water management system operational indicator
Definition: A "yes/no" indicator whether the ship ballast water management system is fully operational.

Data Element: Ballast water management plan contingency measure(s), coded
Definition: A code indicating the contingency measure(s) included in the Ballast Water Management Plan.

Data Element: Ballast water management plan contingency measures description
Definition: A description of the contingency measure(s) included in the Ballast Water Management Plan.

Data Element: Ballast water management plan contingency measure(s) deployed indicator
Definition: A  "yes/no" indicator on whether any contingency measure(s)  in the Ballast Water Management Plan have been deployed.

Data Element: Ballast water ship coupling interface indicator
Definition: A  "yes/no" indicator on whether the ship has an interface available for coupling to a ballast water reception facility.

Name or identification number of the ballast tank or hold.
